title: A Simple Lemma of Open Maps and it's usage
description: Suppose $a < b$ is defined with $a \in \mathbb{R} \cup \{ -\infty \}, b \in \mathbb{R}$ and $f: (a, b) 	o \mathbb{R}$ is increasing and is an open map and $f((a, b)) \subseteq (a, b)$ and $x \in (a, b)$ implies $f(x) > x$, then if $(x_n)$ is a sequence which starts out in $(a, b)$ and is recursively defined with $f$, therefore $x_1 \in (a, b)$ and $x_{n+1} = f(x_n)$, then $(x_n) \to b$.

title: The convergence of sequences in the form $x_{n+1} = \frac{1}{r-x_n}$ with $|r| \geq 2$
description: A full investigation on the convergence of sequences in the form of The convergence of sequences in the form $x_{n+1} = \frac{1}{r-x_n}$ with $|r| \geq 2$
